field.name: overridespacer
field.label:
By overriding we will be able to gain performance as we base the code on PHP native json routines and also be able to use the parameter overrides below. The disadvantage is that we can not mix these with various K2 related modules that make effort of loading K2 item model explicitly through PHP file including or requires.

If you want to use these overrides please do set the [Override K2 item model] below to [Yes]

field.description: Parameters from this category will override parameters in all other categories except categories excluded below. For all categories excluded parameters will not be overriden.

field.name: accesstabsineditform
field.label: Reconfigure tabs in edit form
field.description:
Here you can choose which K2 tabs to be included and the name each tab should have. For each category provide the following settings with %% between the settings and a new line for each category to reconfigure the set of tabs for:

* category ID to which the setting should apply, or alternatively [all] to apply to all categories. If you provide category ID please note that it will be applied to all child categories as well
* comma separated list of child categories that should be excluded from this setting or leave it empty if non
* comma separated list of tabs to be included with the format: tab=newtabname. Available tab options are: content, image, gallery, video, extrafields, attachment, plugin
* client this setting should be applied to. Applicable values are site, admin, all or simply leave it empty and it will be applied to all

Example:all%%%%extrafields=Data%%all
For all categories and in both admin and site clients only the extra fields tab is shown and the tab will be named Data

field.name: mediaroot
field.label: Media root folder
field.description: Location where uploaded media files are stored. For Browse server mode please note that all media files in this folder which user have access to will be made available. Media files to which user have access to is defined as all media files found in K2 items which user is author of.

field.name: mediafolder
field.label: Media folder (within the root folder)
field.description: Media files are uploaded to folders specific to each item or user, depending on your setting here.

field.name: mediaoverwrite
field.label: Overwrite on upload if file exsists
field.description: If overwrite is not allowed then we always append timestamp to file name to avoid potential file name collision.

field.name: picresize
field.label: Resize picture
field.description: If picture is in its width and/or height larger than what is allowed and if resizing is allowed then we will resize it, if not upload is rejected

field.name: piccreatethumb

field.description: While most plugins create there own thumbnails some require to be provided with thumbnails which are indicated by thumb postfix in the plugin list.

field.name: thumbfolder

field.description: Notice: if you combine the use of plugins that creates there own thumbnails with this feature turned on make sure that the folder name doesn't collide, or make sure that thumb creation is turned off in the [Thumbnail mode] option (this might make it difficult to switch to plugins that doesn't render thumbnails later on).

field.name: socialincludeitems
field.label: Click on button to remove item

field.name: socialexcludeitems
field.label: Click on button to remove item

field.name: socialdisplay
field.label: Buttons to display
field.description: Comma separated and ordered list of facebook,twitter,linkedin,googleplus,pinterest,readability,flattr

field.name: socialfacebooksend
field.label: Show send button
field.description: The Send Button allows users to easily send content to their friends. People will have the option to send your URL in a message to their Facebook friends, to the group wall of one of their Facebook groups, and as an email to any email address. While the Like Button allows users to share content with all of their friends, the Send Button allows them to send a private message to just a few friends.

field.name: socialfacebooklayout
field.label: Layout style
field.description: Standard - displays social text to the right of the button and friends profile photos below. Button count - displays the total number of likes to the right of the button. Box count - displays the total number of likes above the button.

field.name: socialfacebookshow_faces
field.label: Show faces (standard layout only)
field.description: Display profile photos below the button.

field.name: socialpinterestdescriptiontext
field.label: Description text(if text is chosen above)

field.name: socialflattruid
field.label: A Flattr username
field.description: This is a required parameter for autosubmit but not for things that are already on flattr.com.

field.name: socialflattrtitle
field.label: Title (replacing current item title)
field.description: Will be used to describe your thing on Fattr. The title should be between 5-100 characters. All HTML is stripped. This is a required parameter for autosubmit but not for things that are already on flattr.com.

field.name: socialflattrdescription
field.label: Description (replacing current item meta tag)
field.description: Will be used to describe your thing. The description should be between 5-1000 characters. All HTML is stripped except the <br\> character which will be converted into newlines (\n). This is a required parameter for autosubmit but not for things that are already on flattr.com.

field.name: socialflattrcategory
field.label: Category
field.description: This parameter is used to sort things on Flattr and has no impact on the functionality of your button.

field.name: socialflattrhidden
field.label: Hidden
field.description: Not all content is suitable for public listing. If you for one reason or another don't want your content to be listed on Flattr set this parameter to hidden.

field.name: paginationmode
field.label: Pagination mode. Leading layout is assumed in this case and all other layouts are disregarded.

field.name: showvalue
field.label: Hierarchy list values - show in item view

field.name: appendtitleglue

field.name: actionaftersave
